graph.original_query: Create a professional one-page (index.html) dark-themed (Black and White only) portfolio website for a Software Hacker using Tailwind CSS, Flowbite, Animate.css (for scroll-in section reveals and CTA hover transitions), and Splide.js (for a testimonial carousel and horizontally scrolling image gallery); use CDN only (no build tools); apply a sleek black/charcoal base, warm beige/muted orange accents, elegant typography, refined spacing, subtle transitions (no glows/neons); include sticky header with anchor links, hero section with fullscreen image (https://picsum.photos/1600/900?blur=1), category highlight cards (https://picsum.photos/400/600?grayscale/random=1), animated counters (clients, projects, years), About (mission, timeline), Gallery or Services grid (6–8 projects), Contact form (name/email/message), and footer with social icons; keep layout responsive and professional, with no lorem ipsum, real readable text, and pure HTML/CSS/JS; Use CoderAgent in 9–10 precise updates (meta, header, hero, counters, cards, timeline, gallery, testimonial slider, contact form, layout cleanup), and finally audit spacing, contrast, and visual balance to ensure premium Software Hacker look. Ask the CoderAgent to update the same index.html, use code to update it if file is longer and make sure old content is not deleted, and only required sections are updated. Remind CoderAgent to update the placeholders (not overwrite whole file)

T001.initial_thoughts: Okay, I will create a basic HTML structure for a one-page portfolio website with a sticky header and placeholders for the specified sections. I'll include CDN links for Tailwind CSS, Flowbite, Animate.css, and Splide.js. I'll also add meta tags for dark theme support and incorporate Tailwind CSS classes for a black/charcoal base, warm beige/muted orange accents, elegant typography, refined spacing, and subtle transitions. The structure will use placeholders so that future calls can update the same index.html without overwriting the whole file, ensuring that only the required sections are updated.

files.index.html:
Portfolio
Hero Counters Cards Timeline Gallery Testimonials Contact

nodes.description: Create the basic HTML structure for the one-page portfolio website with a sticky header and placeholders for the hero section, counters, cards, timeline, gallery, testimonial slider, contact form, and footer. Include CDN links for Tailwind CSS, Flowbite, Animate.css, and Splide.js. Use meta tags to setup dark theme. Add general CSS styling for black/charcoal base, beige/muted orange accents, and elegant typography.
nodes.agent_prompt: Create a basic HTML structure for a one-page portfolio website with a sticky header and placeholders for the hero section (<!-- HERO_SECTION -->), counters (<!-- COUNTERS_SECTION -->), category highlight cards (<!-- CARDS_SECTION -->), timeline (<!-- TIMELINE_SECTION -->), gallery (<!-- GALLERY_SECTION -->), testimonial slider (<!-- TESTIMONIAL_SLIDER -->), contact form (<!-- CONTACT_FORM -->), and footer (<!-- FOOTER_SECTION -->). Include CDN links for Tailwind CSS, Flowbite, Animate.css, and Splide.js. Include meta tags to setup dark theme using <meta name="color-scheme" content="dark"> and <meta name="supported-color-schemes" content="dark">. Add general CSS styling using Tailwind CSS for a black/charcoal base, warm beige/muted orange accents, elegant typography, refined spacing, and subtle transitions. Create placeholders with comments for sections to be added in future calls. Make sure to use correct CSS class names to achieve the dark theme. Remember to use placeholders so that future calls can update the same index.html without overwriting the whole file and only required sections are updated.

output.initial_thoughts: Okay, I will create a basic HTML structure for a one-page portfolio website with a sticky header and placeholders for the specified sections. I'll include CDN links for Tailwind CSS, Flowbite, Animate.css, and Splide.js. I'll also add meta tags for dark theme support and incorporate Tailwind CSS classes for a black/charcoal base, warm beige/muted orange accents, elegant typography, refined spacing, and subtle transitions. The structure will use placeholders so that future calls can update the same index.html without overwriting the whole file, ensuring that only the required sections are updated.

files.index.html:
Portfolio
Hero Counters Cards Timeline Gallery Testimonials Contact

nodes.description: Populate the hero section with a fullscreen image from https://picsum.photos/1600/900?blur=1, a title, and a brief introduction, using Tailwind CSS for styling and responsiveness.
nodes.agent_prompt: Populate the hero section (<!-- HERO_SECTION -->) with a fullscreen image from https://picsum.photos/1600/900?blur=1, a title, and a brief introduction, using Tailwind CSS for styling and responsiveness. Make sure the image covers the whole screen. Use a relevant title and introduction about a software hacker. Remember to only update the HERO_SECTION placeholder in the index.html and not overwrite the whole file. Use Tailwind CSS classes to set the correct styling.  The placeholder is: <!-- HERO_SECTION -->

nodes.description: Implement animated counters for clients, projects, and years of experience. Use Tailwind CSS for styling and JavaScript for animation. Make it such that the values are realistic and not too large or too small.
nodes.agent_prompt: Implement animated counters for clients, projects, and years of experience in the COUNTERS_SECTION (<!-- COUNTERS_SECTION -->) using Tailwind CSS for styling and JavaScript for animation. Make the design sleek and professional, using the black/charcoal base and beige/muted orange accents. Make sure to use correct CSS class names to achieve the dark theme and good contrast. Update the values realistically, such that it seems realistic for a software hacker. Remember to only update the COUNTERS_SECTION placeholder in the index.html and not overwrite the whole file. The placeholder is: <!-- COUNTERS_SECTION -->

nodes.description: Create category highlight cards (using images from https://picsum.photos/400/600?grayscale/random=1) for different skills or areas of expertise, using Tailwind CSS for styling and responsiveness. Add scroll-in reveals using Animate.css.
nodes.agent_prompt: Create category highlight cards in the CARDS_SECTION (<!-- CARDS_SECTION -->) for different skills or areas of expertise, using images from https://picsum.photos/400/600?grayscale/random=1. Use Tailwind CSS for styling and responsiveness. Add scroll-in reveals using Animate.css. Add titles and short descriptions for each card, making sure they align well with the theme and content. Update the CARDS_SECTION placeholder in the index.html and not overwrite the whole file. Use Tailwind CSS to achieve dark theme. The placeholder is: <!-- CARDS_SECTION -->

nodes.description: Develop the About section with a mission statement and a timeline of key achievements, using Tailwind CSS for styling. Make the timeline visually appealing and easy to follow.
nodes.agent_prompt: Develop the About section with a mission statement and a timeline of key achievements in the TIMELINE_SECTION (<!-- TIMELINE_SECTION -->), using Tailwind CSS for styling. Use a mission statement that aligns well with a software hacker. Make the timeline visually appealing and easy to follow. Use Tailwind CSS to achieve dark theme. Update the TIMELINE_SECTION placeholder in the index.html and not overwrite the whole file. The placeholder is: <!-- TIMELINE_SECTION -->

nodes.description: Build the Gallery or Services grid with 6–8 projects, using Tailwind CSS for styling and responsiveness. Use real readable text for project descriptions.
nodes.agent_prompt: Build the Gallery or Services grid with 6–8 projects in the GALLERY_SECTION (<!-- GALLERY_SECTION -->), using Tailwind CSS for styling and responsiveness. Use real readable text for project descriptions, not lorem ipsum. Make the descriptions about hacking or software engineering. Update the GALLERY_SECTION placeholder in the index.html and not overwrite the whole file. The placeholder is: <!-- GALLERY_SECTION -->

nodes.description: Implement a testimonial carousel using Splide.js, using Tailwind CSS for styling. Insert 3-4 testimonial texts.
nodes.agent_prompt: Implement a testimonial carousel using Splide.js in the TESTIMONIAL_SLIDER (<!-- TESTIMONIAL_SLIDER -->) section, using Tailwind CSS for styling. Insert 3-4 testimonial texts that fit well with the context. Update the TESTIMONIAL_SLIDER placeholder in the index.html and not overwrite the whole file. Remember to initiate the Splide.js library with the correct class names and configurations. Make sure to use correct CSS class names to achieve the dark theme and good contrast. The placeholder is: <!-- TESTIMONIAL_SLIDER -->

nodes.description: Create a Contact form with name, email, and message fields, using Tailwind CSS for styling and responsiveness. Add basic validation (email format).
nodes.agent_prompt: Create a Contact form with name, email, and message fields in the CONTACT_FORM section (<!-- CONTACT_FORM -->), using Tailwind CSS for styling and responsiveness. Add basic validation (email format). Update the CONTACT_FORM placeholder in the index.html and not overwrite the whole file. Make sure to use correct CSS class names to achieve the dark theme and good contrast. The placeholder is: <!-- CONTACT_FORM -->

nodes.description: Design the footer with social icons, using Tailwind CSS for styling. Ensure the icons are visually appealing and link to relevant profiles.
nodes.agent_prompt: Design the footer with social icons in the FOOTER_SECTION (<!-- FOOTER_SECTION -->), using Tailwind CSS for styling. Ensure the icons are visually appealing and link to relevant profiles. Update the FOOTER_SECTION placeholder in the index.html and not overwrite the whole file. Make sure to use correct CSS class names to achieve the dark theme and good contrast. Add FontAwesome CDN to enable beautiful icons. The placeholder is: <!-- FOOTER_SECTION -->

nodes.description: Audit spacing, contrast, and visual balance to ensure a premium Software Hacker look. Refine the overall layout and aesthetics.
nodes.agent_prompt: Audit spacing, contrast, and visual balance to ensure a premium Software Hacker look. Refine the overall layout and aesthetics in the entire website index.html file. Pay special attention to the use of dark theme and text readability. Make sure to use correct CSS class names to achieve the dark theme and good contrast. Also, double check previous code is intact. The placeholder is: None

nodes.description: Distill and summarize the final HTML file to ensure code is not broken.
nodes.agent_prompt: Analyze the final HTML file and summarize the structure, styles, and functionality. Ensure the code is well-structured, and no errors are present.
